Package edu.bu.labs.rttt.traversal

Class Node

java.lang.Object
edu.bu.labs.rttt.traversal.Node
public class Node extends Object
A class that represents a vertex in the game tree that adversarial search agents expand. A Node contains a RecursiveTicTacToeGame.RecursiveTicTacToeGameView object containing the state of the game. It also contains a Coordinate which is move just made by a player to get to this state as well as the utility value of this state.
See Also:
  • RecursiveTicTacToeGame.RecursiveTicTacToeGameView

      public Node(RecursiveTicTacToeGame.RecursiveTicTacToeGameView view, PlayerType myPlayerType, int depth)
      A constructor to initialize a Node with the state of the game, who is the MAX player, and the depth of the node in the tree.
      Parameters:
      view - The state of the game.
      myPlayerType - The PlayerType of the MAX player.
      depth - The depth of this Node in the tree.

    • isTerminal

      public final boolean isTerminal()
      A getter method to get if this state is terminal or not (e.g. is the game over or not).
      Returns:
      true if this state is terminal and false otherwise.

    • getUtilityValue

      public final double getUtilityValue()
      A getter method to get the utility value of this Node. If this Node is terminal, this is calculated for you.
      Returns:
      The utility value of this Node. May require you to set it.

    • getLastMove

      public final Coordinate getLastMove()
      A getter method to get the last move made (e.g. the move that produced the state stored in this Node). This will be null at the root.
      Returns:
      The move that produced the state of the game stored in this Node. Will be null at the root.

    • setUtilityValue

      public void setUtilityValue(double d)
      A setter method to set the utility of this Node. Do not set the utility of terminal Nodes.
      Parameters:
      d - The new utility value.

    • getOppositePlayerType

      public PlayerType getOppositePlayerType()
      A method to get the PlayerType of the MIN player.
      Returns:
      The PlayerType of the MIN player.

    • getTerminalUtility

      public final double getTerminalUtility()
      A method to calculate the terminal utility of this Node. Only works if this Node is terminal (will produce -1 if called on a nonterminal Node). When this Node is terminal, it will produce +100 if the MAX player won, -100 if the MAX player lost, and 0 if a tie.
      Returns:
      -1 if nonterminal. If terminal, will return +100 if MAX wins, -100 if MAX loses, and 0 otherwise.

    • getChildren

      public List<Node> getChildren()
      A method to get a list of Node objects representing all moves that could be made by the current player. For each legal move, a Node object is produced containing the state of the game if that move was made. The "last move made" of the child Node is set to be the move made that produced the child state of the game.
      Returns:
      The list of child Node objects: one Node per legal move the current player can make in the given state.
